intro: Galium sevanense, commonly known as Sevan bedstraw, is a perennial herb native to the Caucasus region. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are often hairy and have a distinct, slightly aromatic scent. Galium sevanense is typically found in moist, shaded habitats such as woodlands and stream banks.
